reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd give it a zero if not for the nice view of the Monterey Bay!
reviews.title: For the amount of money charged, it's terrible! Here's why!

reviews.text: Our room was over $200/night and we got average amenities and a unit that has an outdated bathroom and wallpaper. Our balcony was full of mosquitoes to boot! Our room was 610. I complained to the front desk supervisor, Ashley, regarding the mosquitoes problem and she told me there was nothing they can do because Monterey has mosquito problems year round! She did not offer to make any amends other than I am sorry about it, but all I can do is to send someone up to clean up the balcony. Hello! They are live mosquitoes, so how are you gonna clean them up? The elevators are slow and one was out of order.
reviews.title: Saved our weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are the pro's and con's:
reviews.title: Nice hotel but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Availability to Check in early, decent breakfast, and a nice view of the Monterey Bay.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Cons: MOSQUITOES HEADQUARTER! OUR BALCONY WAS FULL OF THEM! Cannot even go out to the balcony to enjoy the view because I did not want to be attacked by them!
reviews.title: Dated hotel in decent location.
Great location, cold water
reviews.text: We have spent 7 of the last 8 nights at various Embassy Suites properties across CA. This hotel was one of the better ones. The rooms were larger and much quieter, especially on the 10th floor (1019). The breakfast was one of the best and the staff were great. I would happily stay here again. One problem, however, was the hot water. It took almost 10 min for the water to even get hot in the shower and then it didn't stay hot. The shower head was also off center and it was hard to stand under given the obstructions of the bars and soap trays. Other than that all was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent the weekend in Monterey. The Embassy Suites was the perfect location, close to town and restaurants, across from a wide sandy beach you could follow to town. Also there were bike paths to use and lots of bike rental places. Around the hotel were small lakes with walking paths and lots of water birds.
reviews.title: Great Happy Hour and close to every thing!

reviews.text: The breakfast had a chef make eggs, and omelettes to order, also hot items in the buffet with plenty of choices. The Happy Hour had well drinks, wine and other non-alcoholic drinks plus snacks. Rooms were comfy and we were upgraded to a beautiful room with views of the Pacific and the beaches. Spent most of our days sight seeing but did use the gym a few times.
reviews.title: My review is pertaining to the employee Michelle Simpson who works in the restaurant

reviews.text: I just wanted to share my experience with the management regarding your employee Michelle Simpson. I stayed in Monterey at the Embassy Suites about 2 months ago and was extremely impressed with how pleasant and diligent Ms. Simpson was with her constant professionalism ensuring all my needs were met. Michelle is a huge reason why I would stay at the hotel in the future. Thank you again for hiring people like Michelle making my experience that more pleasurable.
reviews.title: Little to be desired

reviews.text: Jeff Whitlock
reviews.title: Not up to standard

reviews.text: Changed rooms first hour because of noise in heater next room had tub faucet leaking reported it when I went out that morning when I returned not fixed to tired to change rooms again. Tired hotel but staff very good.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.text: Despite unavoidable highway noise, we loved our big corner king suite at this lovely and friendly hotel. It is very close by car to the Monterey fisherman's wharf and Cannery Row. The breakfast staff was outstandingly nice...I even got a hug as a thank you for a tip. Nice box with several bags of tea and coffee in the "kitchen" area.
reviews.title: Excellent Breakfast Staff, big room, lovely water views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drove from San Francisco to this hotel, plenty of parking spaces. Check in was fast and efficient. The room was huge! lounge, kitchen area with tea coffee making, and full size fridge. 2 queen size beds, lots of storage space. Free drinks available in the bar area up to a certain time, and complimentary breakfast, this was very good lot's of choice hot and tasty. We only stayed one night, but I would recommend this hotel as a stop off or to explore Monterey. Only a short drive to the pier, see the seals, and cute shops. (lovely silver shop on the pier ladies!)
reviews.title: Top Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was great, the managers reception was great, the morning breakfast wa excellent, good variety. The room was clean and well stocked. Great view from room. A corner room is the best. Windows open just enough to get a fresh ocean breeze.
reviews.title: Best stay ever

reviews.text: Our second visit of this trip to an Embassy suites. After the excellence of the first one we thought we may be disappointed but am pleased to say we had a delightful stay. Check in was pleasant and quick. I asked if they sold milk and was told no but straight away one of the 2 charming receptionists said they would get me some from the managers reception. It was at our room as we arrived with our case. EXCELLENT. The room was spacious and clean with all the facilities that are required. We could see the sea from the window. Beds were clean and comfortable. We had a smoking room but well done to the housekeeping staff - it did not smell of smoke at all, which we much appreciated. The glass lift enabled you to have a good view of the enormous atrium - very pleasant it is. Breakfast is served in the atrium so very nice surroundings. Cereals, muffins, sausage, bacon, juice, coffee etc: as well as made to order omelettes which were delicious. The breakfast staff were lovely and friendly. We didn't have time to try the facilities as we had 2 long days sightseeing. This is an excellent location for seeing Monterey, 17 mile drive and Bid Sur and not too far from San Francisco so and ideal base. Would certainly be delighted to stay here again if in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Embassy.

reviews.text: A good deal. Big rooms. All suites. Big breakfast. Free happy hour. Free parking. Near Monterey. Yes this is an 80s central atrium hotel. But it works. And great for kids. And lots to do nearby. Prices are pretty good.
reviews.title: Great family hotel by the sea

reviews.text: This Embassy Suites is average at best. Room furnishings were worn and air was stuffy. We stay a Embassy Suites often when traveling with the kids which is why we picked this location rather than staying in Monterey. The hotel is set back across the highway from the beach. It is near a Home Depot, McDonalds, Starbucks and a few other strip mall type amenities. It is a very generic setting, so don’t come expecting much in the way of charm. It is not far from Monterey and Carmel and parking is plentiful. Overall, I think there are better choices that are comparably priced in Monterey and Carmel. I would not stay here again. Nothing horrible, just not up to the standards other Embassy Suites I have stayed.
reviews.title: Average is the best way to sum it up

reviews.text: By far the worst Embassy Suites I have ever stayed at. I travel quite a bit now and try to stay at Hiltons where possible.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't want to gross people out but finding bugs in the bed was a start of a horrible experience. When a person came to out room to move us to another room, he stated, "Yeah, that has happened before".
reviews.title: Good Family Vacation Hotel

reviews.text: Had to call corporate to report and get a refund, local management said they would comp our room that night but never did. I could go on and on about what they said they would do and did not.
reviews.title: Awesome!
